scenarioDescription:
The HD 112640 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 112640 is a star with 1.8 times the mass of the Sun, and 39 times its radius. It is located 1054.58 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.6 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 112640 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 112640 system


HD 112640 b

HD 112640 b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory, in 2020-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.70 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 112640 b is 1590.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 112640 b is 12.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 112640 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 112640, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
name: HD 112640 - System With 1 Exoplanet
